list.text:
Add bright blue to your color palette.
Reds, browns, and yellows are frequently cited as "fall colors," but don't underestimate how stunning a bright indigo shade can work in your autumn wardrobe. And matching your shoes to your shirt — instant chic.

Try an oh-so-trendy fringe jacket.
Fall 2015 is all about fringe — it adds a small dose of cowboy cool, but with a high fashion vibe. Wear it with a suede purse, a chunky pair of black boots, and an all-black ensemble, right down to your sunglasses.

Pair a plum jacket with a pencil skirt.
A jewel-toned jacket is a beautiful way to add color into your wardrobe. Wear it over a pencil skirt for work or going out, or with your favorite pair of jeans plus sneakers for a casual daytime look.

Pair a soft sweater with a denim skirt.
Play with different materials to create a standout autumn look. A durable denim skirt plus a stylish sweater (and matching shoes!) make this a perfect seasonal transition outfit.

Layer a cape over a jumpsuit.
Colorblocking doesn't have to be limited to dresses, tops, and pants — branch out by finding yourself the perfect solid jumpsuit that works for any evening occasion, then add a white cape to give your look serious oomph.

Layer solids over patterns.
A busy geometric pattern looks fantastic when balanced with basic outerwear and accessories. If you want to wear a dress but don't want to freeze once the temperature cools down, add a simple black moto jacket overtop.
